intro: Manettia congesta, commonly known as the clustered manettia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are arranged in cymes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
